definition: (of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Remember to stop, do not let me pierce the paper goes on already full of loopholes.
sentences.chinese: 记得适可而止，别让我捅破那张早已漏洞百出的纸。

sentences.english: This is an argument shot through with inconsistency.
sentences.chinese: 这个论点前后矛盾，漏洞百出。

sentences.english: His account of the robbery won't hold water.
sentences.chinese: 他对抢劫案经过的陈述漏洞百出。

sentences.english: Such articles would be more than fluff if they answered critical questions.
sentences.chinese: 这类的文章在面对批评性的质疑时总会漏洞百出。

sentences.english: Not knowing their own flaws is already doddering attitude.
sentences.chinese: 殊不知自身漏洞百出早已呈老态龙钟之态。

sentences.english: To begin with, our borders have been porous for decades.
sentences.chinese: 首先，数十年来我们的边境早已漏洞百出。

definition: (of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
clumsy/botched
(following a noun) full of .../abounding in ...
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
error and negligence
to contradict oneself/self-contradictory/inconsistent
lit. not one drop of water can leak out/watertight/rigorous (argument)
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
lie
ill-founded/groundless
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
